item.title: Drop %
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

npcdrop = NPCID ITEMID AMOUNT %
Then on a different line
npcdrop = NPCID ITEMID AMOUNT %

Each npc can have multiple drops.

Read full topic

item.description:
@twins wrote:

so you saying i should make npcdrops.cfg?

If i do can i make it like:

npcdrop = NPCID	ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%    ITEMID	AMOUNT	%    ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%     ITEMID	AMOUNT	%

item.title: Drop %
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

It’s much easier if you use a CFG or Java file for drops.

For example, you can simply list the:

NPCID
DROPS
DROP %

Therefore accomplishing the same thing that you are trying to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Drop %
item.dc:creator: @twins twins
item.description:
@twins wrote:

Ok… I am trying to make Magical Axe Drop an Item Rarely So I puted this in Item.java

public static int Axe[] = {1367,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995,995}; public static int randomAxe() { return Axe[(int)(Math.random()*Axe.length)]; }
where else am i suppose to put so he will drop this?

Read full topic
